description.narrative: 1. Access to Microfinance: This project will help in expanding the outreach of access to microfinance to borrowers who have little or no access to formal sources of financing with Suryoday expected to provide financing to more than 1 million women borrowers in the next 3-5 years 2. Balanced growth of Microfinance: This project will promote a more balanced growth of microfinance in India. Suryoday''s operations are expanding in Western India where MFI penetration has historically been low

This proposed project involves a quasi-equity and senior debt investment in Suryoday Microfinance Private Limited (Suryoday or the Company) which is a micro finance institution operating as a non banking finance company primarily in Western India. The Company has a borrower base of approximately 145,000 borrowers and a gross loan portfolio in excess of INR1,200 million across 5 states. Suryodays customer segment includes salaried women (informal sector) working as housemaids, cooks or in small factories and self employed women working as vegetable / fruit vendors, small shop owners etc. Suryoday has been proactive in deployment of technology and is establishing itself as a customer centric institution with a commitment to responsible finance. IFCs proposed investment will help Suryoday expand its operations by strengthening its balance sheet, providing access to diversified funding sources and meeting its regulatory capital adequacy requirements for the next 2-3 years.
